channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VA

item.title: Report E-2024020442
item.description:
Report E-2024020442

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T18:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-19
  • City: LYNCHBURG
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLI TRANSPORT, LP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Company Fuel Driver was delivering gasoline at store at 09:03am. Company driver had two hoses connected from the trailer belly valves to the underground fuel storage tank (UST), and was in the process of unloading fuel. Cones were in place to protect the area as well as vehicle lights activated for warnings. A white pickup truck (Super Duty) bearing Maryland registration # 9EC0549, pulling a cement mixer trailer, disregarded the activated lights and orange security cones of our vehicle; and drove over the hose fitting connected to the UST and tore the delivery hose coupler and the lip off the UST, subsequently releasing approximately 20 gallons of gasoline onto the pavement. VA State Police (Trooper J.B. Moore) was notified, arrived at the location of the "hit and run" regarding the pickup truck. Fuel driver captured a photo of the truck license plate that ran over the fitting and hose and provided plate # to Law Enforcement. Material spilled was contained by the fuel driver using absorbent pads, and emptied the remaining fuel in the hose into the UST. No fuel contaminated the ground nor entered into any water systems.

item.title: Report X-2024021102
item.description:
Report X-2024021102

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-30
  • City: NORFOLK
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THIS MORNING THE PACKAGE CAME OUT THE TRAILER LEAKING FROM THE INSIDE OF THE BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS SLAMMED ON THE ROLLERS CAUSING THE METHANOL BOTTLE TO UNSCREW AND SPILL DescribePack: DURING THE INSPECTION I NOTICED THAT THE BOTTLE CAP WAS LOOOSE. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: THE DAMAGED HAZMAT WAS PLACED IN A SAFETY CONTAINER TO PREVENT OTHER PACKAGES FROM GETTING DAMAGED.

item.title: Report I-2024020007
item.description:
Report I-2024020007

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-22T15:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-22
  • City: DULLES
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: *During boarding process, passenger had a backpack carry-on that began smoking. *The passenger emptied the inflamed contents onto seat 58G. * The flight attendant used the water from liter and a half bottle to put out the flame. *Then placed the bag in a TCB and placed in the aft lav until the Fire Department arrived. *The fire department collected Thermal Bag with the backpack *The items inside the bag were a vape pen and lithium batteries that were disconnected *No passenger or crew injury. Passenger Information: [PII REDACTED - GEM]
